publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4337<> Alex Fergusson: Birth of James Clerk Maxwell—That the Parliament acknowledges the 175th anniversary of the birth of James Clerk Maxwell on 13 June 2006; recognises his great achievement in discovering the nature of electromagnetic waves which opened the way to the invention of television, radio, radar and the mobile phone; applauds his work on colour perception which enabled the successful development of colour television and colour photography, and believes that he is worthy of greater recognition throughout Scotland, given the acknowledgement of Albert Einstein, who said that "the special theory of relativity owes its origins to Maxwell’s equations of the electromagnetic field", and of Ivan Tolstoy, who wrote "Maxwell’s importance in the history of scientific thought is comparable to Einstein’s (whom he inspired) and to Newton’s (whose influence he curtailed)".
S2M-4337<> Birth of James Clerk Maxwell (lodged on 3 May 2006) Stewart Stevenson*

S2M-4337*#* Alex Fergusson: Birth of James Clerk Maxwell—That the Parliament acknowledges the 175th anniversary of the birth of James Clerk Maxwell on 13 June 2006; recognises his great achievement in discovering the nature of electromagnetic waves which opened the way to the invention of television, radio, radar and the mobile phone; applauds his work on colour perception which enabled the successful development of colour television and colour photography, and believes that he is worthy of greater recognition throughout Scotland, given the acknowledgement of Albert Einstein, who said that "the special theory of relativity owes its origins to Maxwell’s equations of the electromagnetic field", and of Ivan Tolstoy, who wrote "Maxwell’s importance in the history of scientific thought is comparable to Einstein’s (whom he inspired) and to Newton’s (whose influence he curtailed)". Supported by: Stewart Stevenson, Murray Tosh*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Alex Johnstone*, Phil Gallie*, Christine Grahame*, John Farquhar Munro*, Rob Gibson*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Eleanor Scott*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Sarah Boyack*, Murdo Fraser*, Mike Pringle*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*

S2M-4337# Birth of James Clerk Maxwell (lodged on 3 May 2006) Brian Adam*, Bruce Crawford*, Mr David Davidson*, Linda Fabiani*, Robin Harper*, Patrick Harvie*, Des McNulty*, Alex Neil*, Nora Radcliffe*, Dr Jean Turner*, Mr Jim Wallace*, Bill Aitken*
S2M-4337# Birth of James Clerk Maxwell (lodged on 3 May 2006) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Donald Gorrie*, Derek Brownlee*, Mrs Nanette Milne*
S2M-4337# Birth of James Clerk Maxwell (lodged on 3 May 2006) Alasdair Morgan*, Tommy Sheridan*, Ms Maureen Watt*, Mr Brian Monteith*
S2M-4337# Birth of James Clerk Maxwell (lodged on 3 May 2006) Mr Adam Ingram*, Dave Petrie*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*
S2M-4337# Birth of James Clerk Maxwell (lodged on 3 May 2006) Mr Jamie Stone*
S2M-4337# Birth of James Clerk Maxwell (lodged on 3 May 2006) Fiona Hyslop*
S2M-4337# Birth of James Clerk Maxwell (lodged on 3 May 2006) Maureen Macmillan* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J

S2M-4337# Alex Fergusson: Birth of James Clerk Maxwell—That the Parliament acknowledges the 175th anniversary of the birth of James Clerk Maxwell on 13 June 2006; recognises his great achievement in discovering the nature of electromagnetic waves which opened the way to the invention of television, radio, radar and the mobile phone; applauds his work on colour perception which enabled the successful development of colour television and colour photography, and believes that he is worthy of greater recognition throughout Scotland, given the acknowledgement of Albert Einstein, who said that "the special theory of relativity owes its origins to Maxwell’s equations of the electromagnetic field", and of Ivan Tolstoy, who wrote "Maxwell’s importance in the history of scientific thought is comparable to Einstein’s (whom he inspired) and to Newton’s (whose influence he curtailed)". Supported by: Stewart Stevenson, Murray Tosh, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Roseanna Cunningham, Alex Johnstone, Phil Gallie, Christine Grahame, John Farquhar Munro, Rob Gibson, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Dr Elaine Murray, Eleanor Scott, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Sarah Boyack, Murdo Fraser, Mike Pringle, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Brian Adam, Bruce Crawford, Mr David Davidson, Linda Fabiani, Robin Harper, Patrick Harvie, Des McNulty, Alex Neil, Nora Radcliffe, Dr Jean Turner, Mr Jim Wallace, Bill Aitken, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Donald Gorrie, Derek Brownlee, Mrs Nanette Milne, Alasdair Morgan, Tommy Sheridan, Ms Maureen Watt, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Adam Ingram, Dave Petrie, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr Jamie Stone, Fiona Hyslop, Maureen Macmillan Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
